SEARCH
Package at.htl.timetableGenerator.model

Class Timetable

java.lang.Object
at.htl.timetableGenerator.model.Timetable
public class Timetable extends Object
This class represents a timetable in a School. A timetable is defined by a number of days per week, a maximum number of hours per day, and a set of constraints. It provides methods to get and set the timetable, check if a subject is in the timetable, check if a double hour spot is available for a subject, and get a lesson at a given time slot.

    • checkConstraints

      public boolean checkConstraints(TimeSlot timeSlot, Subject subject)
      Checks if the given time slot and course meet all constraints.
      Parameters:
      timeSlot - The time slot to check.
      subject - The subject to check.
      Returns:
      true if all constraints are met, false otherwise.

    • hasAvailableDoubleHourSpot

      public boolean hasAvailableDoubleHourSpot(Subject subject)
      Checks if there is an available double hour spot for a given course. A double hour spot is defined as a free time slot that is preceded by the given course.
      Parameters:
      subject - The subject to check for.
      Returns:
      true if there is an available double hour spot, false otherwise.

    • getTimetableAsArray

      public Lesson @NotNull [][] getTimetableAsArray()
      Returns the timetable as a 2D array of lessons. The first dimension represents the days of the week, and the second dimension represents the hours of the day. Each element in the array is a lesson at the corresponding day and hour.
      Returns:
      A 2D array of lessons representing the timetable

    • getNoOfSubject

      Gets the number of times a given subject appears in the timetable
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the number of times the subject appears in the timetable
